title: Simple circuits - bulbs X Y in scenarios 1 2

content.question:
Two lightbulbs, Bulb <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Bulb <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, are in a circuit that also has a battery and two switches, as shown in the figures. For each scenario, which bulb or bulbs have current in them?
Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>ACurrent in Bulb <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> onlyCurrent in Bulb <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> onlyBCurrent in Bulb <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> onlyCurrent in both bulbsCCurrent in both bulbsCurrent in Bulb <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> onlyDCurrent in both bulbsCurrent in both bulbs

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
